title: Telomere dynamics in non-model organisms: Developing a standardised approach
findingsText:
The grant funded an international workshop which took place in Drymen, Scotland in August 2011. 

Discussion and collaborations emerging from the workshop have laid the foundation for a much larger network (funded by Leverhulme Trust in 2013) to take forward inter-disciplinary research into variation in telomere dynamics. 

It also resulted in a methods paper being published in Methods in Ecology and Evolution, authored by many of the delegates, that offered a consensus view of methods available for telomere length measurement. The methodological consensus offered by the workshop will likely guide future investigations of telomere dynamics in different species, furthering our understanding of the causes of variation in telomere length and potential longevity among and within species.
